data.funFact: The district is named after the legendary king Bhoja, who ruled over the region in ancient times.
On November 13, 1979, sixteen people were killed by the government of Nepal at Chhintang VDC ward no-1 for demanding democracy. This is known as Chittang Massacre.(Not a fun one)
Illam is famous for it's tea. 6,282,010kg tea was produced in illam in fiscal year 21/22
Halesi Mahadev, a sacred temple of hindus is located in this district. The temple is situated inside a cave
It is the industrial capital of Nepal. Morang has the highest numbers of industries and factories, multinational brands.
Okhaldhunga is the birthplace of the Nepalese poet, Siddhicharan Shrestha, Okhaldhunga is also known as the District of Martyrs.

Panchthar was a part of the ancient Limbuwan kingdom, which was ruled by the Limbu community.The Limbu language and script were used as the official language in Panchthar during the Limbuwan kingdom era.
This district has the deepest valley of the world, Arun Valley and is a land famous for cardamom farming.
The highest mountain in the world Mt.Everest(Sagarmatha) is situated here.
Koshi Tappu Wildlife Reserve , a famous birdwatching destination is located here.
Taplejung is home to the Kanchenjunga Conservation Area, a protected area known for its diverse flora and fauna, including red pandas, snow leopards, musk deer, and various bird species
In Nepali Tehra means Thirteen and Thum means Peak so the name Tehrathum means the place with thirteen peaks.
Nepal's largest cement factory, Udayapur Cement Factory is located here. It was established in 1987
